Entities.Name: Craniofacial Abnormalities
Entities.Definition: Anomalies or deformations in the craniofacial region, which may include the bones of the skull and face, dentition, and associated structures.

Sample Data.Sentence: Abnormalities identified included malocclusions and maxillary hypoplasia.

Entities.Name: Dental Disorders
Entities.Definition: Conditions affecting the health and function of the teeth including structural anomalies, diseases of the teeth and surrounding tissues, or disorders affecting tooth development.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient diagnosed with periodontitis and enamel erosion.

Entities.Name: Oral Phenotypes
Entities.Definition: Characteristics and traits observable in the oral cavity, which can be indicative of broader health issues or genetic conditions.

Sample Data.Sentence: Notable features include gingival overgrowth and oral ulcers.
Sample Data.Annotated: Oral Phenotypes: gingival overgrowth, oral ulcers

Dataset.Name: NIH Clinical Center EHR
Dataset.Details: Data extracted from the EHRs at the NIH Clinical Center, encompassing clinical notes spanning 2007 to 2015, aimed at enhancing the comprehensiveness of craniofacial and oral phenotype vocabularies.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Annotations were based on clinical notes using the cTAKES tool to identify and classify terms related to craniofacial and oral phenotypes. The process included validation by clinical experts and comparison with Human Phenotype Ontology terms.
